title: Geek
data:
- *This article is about the role in [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"). For the [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") role known as the Geek in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), see [Hacker](/wiki/Hacker "Hacker").*

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"De-SLEX and retool accordingly"*

The **Geek** is a role added in [NetHack-The Next Generation](/wiki/NhTNG "NhTNG") that is also available in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") as *Hacker*. It is a melee role that's hard to play.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Starting inventory](#Starting_inventory)
- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [3 Skills](#Skills)
- [4 Geek rank titles](#Geek_rank_titles)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)

## Starting inventory

- a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") +1 [electric sword](/wiki/Electric_sword "Electric sword")
- some [ICs](/wiki/IC "IC")
- +1 [gauntlets of typing](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_typing "Gauntlets of typing")
- 4 [potions of Jolt Cola](/wiki/Potion_of_Jolt_Cola "Potion of Jolt Cola")
- 2 [Hacker's Foods](/wiki/Hacker%27s_Food "Hacker's Food")
- a [pack of floppies](/wiki/Pack_of_floppies "Pack of floppies")

## Intrinsics

Geeks gain intrinsics at these [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1 : [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- XL 1 : [Shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance")
- XL 8 : [Teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control")
- XL 15 : [Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")

## Skills

| Geek skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| ----------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max         | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Basic       | - *Weapons:* [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident"), [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang"), [lightsaber](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber")
- *Combat:* [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts")                                                                                                                                    |
| Skilled     | * *Weapons:* [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")
* *Spells:* [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells"), [protection spells](/wiki/Protection_spells "Protection spells"), [body spells](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells"), [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells")                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Expert      | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [paddle](/wiki/Paddle "Paddle"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- *Spells:* [attack spells](/wiki/Attack_spells "Attack spells"), [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells"), [body spells](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells"), [protection spells](/wiki/Protection_spells "Protection spells"), [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") |

## Geek rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

- XL 1-2: Newbie
- XL 3-5: BASIC Programmer(ess)
- XL 6-9: C Programmer(ess)
- XL 10-13: Hacker(ess)
- XL 14-17: NetHacker(ess)
- XL 18-21: NetHack Programmer(ess)
- XL 22-25: (s)he who uses
- XL 26-29: (s)he who knows
- XL 30: (s)he who learns

## Strategy

Geeks are a slow role (movement speed 10), and their starting equipment isn't great. Acquiring better items is mandatory to survive the early game. They have a good set of available weapon and spellcasting skills, and they may even train their riding skill if they get lucky and find a saddle; riding a [warhorse](/wiki/Warhorse "Warhorse") (preferably one zapped by a [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster")) is definitely preferable to walking around by foot.

The [Geek quest](/wiki/Geek_quest "Geek quest") sees you fighting [Bill Gates](/index.php?title=Bill_Gates\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bill Gates (page does not exist)") for [the NetHack Sources](/wiki/The_NetHack_Sources "The NetHack Sources").

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Geek

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the role in NetHack: The Next Generation. For the SlashTHEM role known as the Geek in NetHack-- 3.0.10, see Hacker.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"De-SLEX and retool accordingly"

The Geek is a role added in NetHack-The Next Generation that is also available in SlashTHEM as Hacker. It is a melee role that's hard to play.

Contents

  • 1 Starting inventory
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Skills
  • 4 Geek rank titles
  • 5 Strategy

Starting inventory

  • a blessed +1 electric sword
  • some ICs
  • +1 gauntlets of typing
  • 4 potions of Jolt Cola
  • 2 Hacker's Foods
  • a pack of floppies

Intrinsics

Geeks gain intrinsics at these experience levels:

  • XL 1 : Poison resistance
  • XL 1 : Shock resistance
  • XL 8 : Teleport control
  • XL 15 : Warning

Skills

Geek skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: mace, flail, trident, lance, sling, firearms, crossbow, dart, boomerang, lightsaber
  • Combat: martial arts
Skilled
  • Weapons: hammer, polearms, crossbow
  • Spells: divination spells, protection spells, body spells, matter spells
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, long sword, club, knife, paddle, dart
  • Spells: attack spells, divination spells, body spells, protection spells, matter spells
  • Combat: riding

Geek rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-2: Newbie
  • XL 3-5: BASIC Programmer(ess)
  • XL 6-9: C Programmer(ess)
  • XL 10-13: Hacker(ess)
  • XL 14-17: NetHacker(ess)
  • XL 18-21: NetHack Programmer(ess)
  • XL 22-25: (s)he who uses
  • XL 26-29: (s)he who knows
  • XL 30: (s)he who learns

Strategy

Geeks are a slow role (movement speed 10), and their starting equipment isn't great. Acquiring better items is mandatory to survive the early game. They have a good set of available weapon and spellcasting skills, and they may even train their riding skill if they get lucky and find a saddle; riding a warhorse (preferably one zapped by a wand of speed monster) is definitely preferable to walking around by foot.

The Geek quest sees you fighting Bill Gates for the NetHack Sources.

The [[Geek quest]] sees you fighting [[Bill Gates]] for [[the NetHack Sources]].
